page.title: 17DONALDSON'S HOSPITAL EDIN.
page.content: {DONALDSON'S HOSPITAL}was opened in 1852 as a school for both deaf and hearing boys and girls.{JAMES {DONALDSON (1751_1830)}an Edinburgh bookseller and publisher was the founder.The architect was {WILLIAM {HENRY PLAYFAIR (1790_1857).} In 1852{QUEEN VICTORIA}visited the school and in 1952 {QUEEN ELIZABETH} visited the school on its centenary. The building which has 5 towers,29 turrets and 164 rooms is 1.2km from the West End of{PRINCES STREET}. Until the{ZEPPELIN RAID}of{1916}the Oriel window of the chapel contained the earliest Scottish specimen of figure stained glass,one small example remains in the building. During {WORLD WAR 2 }the school was evacuated to {COCKBURNSPATH}and the building was used as a{PRISON CAMP}for {ITALIAN}and{GERMAN}soldiers.
